title: Tanks have never felt worse
body:
Especially in the jungle.  I know the mission statement of the tank update was to "Make tanks tankier while taking away damage from them", but where exactly is the tankier part? I don't feel any tankier? Like, Sejuani is the only tank that feels that way, and she's at the top of the banlist right now. Zac feels awful, and Maokai is only a bit higher on the game feel spectrum than him. I keep thinking to myself, I just need to get to this item and then I'll be a threat, until I realize I'm full build and still not a threat, still dying quickly, and not even being able to leave a mark in the health bars of any squishies because I do so little damage now. Thank GOD none of you got the idea in your heads that Sion should be updated too. 

Speaking of Sion, I was almost full build with him and decided to engage a teamfight. I went in with ult, hit the mid laner, and activated Stoneplate while I was at max health so I could apply my CC without dying. I got off one CC before I was half health WITH THE ITEM ACTIVE. What gives? Tankier? When?

As for the jungle, Cinderhulk feels terrible. It's awful. It only helps you clear faster, and then for the rest of the time you don't even realize it's there. I would suggest giving it back it's 25% bonus health scaling up from it's current 15, but I'm pretty sure that wouldn't coincide very well with your lowering of health on key defensive items

replies.body:
If tanks are worse, it could definitely be because their core items are numerically weaker. It could also be because they crutch heavily on Sunfire's damage effect (especially in pvp combat), and that effect undeniably took some hits.

As we continue to get more information, if tanks are too weak, we're in a good position to just do follow up buffs to tanks specifically. If tank items have less Health on them, for example, we can buff up tank Health ratios to compensate, and because we're buffing the tanks and not the items, we're at less risk of balance issues due to poaching.

Basically, it's very possible tanks are weaker than they should be at the moment, but I do think the ecosystem has been improved such that we can more reasonably adjust individual tanks.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-07T20:57:30.533+0000)
>
> If tanks are worse, it could definitely be because their core items are numerically weaker. It could also be because they crutch heavily on Sunfire's damage effect (especially in pvp combat), and that effect undeniably took some hits.
> 
> As we continue to get more information, if tanks are too weak, we're in a good position to just do follow up buffs to tanks specifically. If tank items have less Health on them, for example, we can buff up tank Health ratios to compensate, and because we're buffing the tanks and not the items, we're at less risk of balance issues due to poaching.
> 
> Basically, it's very possible tanks are weaker than they should be at the moment, but I do think the ecosystem has been improved such that we can more reasonably adjust individual tanks.

What kind of things could be buffed though? Not base damages, since you want them to do less damage, right? Maybe base stats like armor or MR? Maybe base health?  Thank you for replying, by the way. You have no idea how good it feels to know that the guys upstairs actually read these threads

Tanks don't need to deal no damage. Imo, they need to not be high damage threats in the mid-late game on tank item builds.

Given that belief, we could do things like buff the base damage of their first max spells while reducing the damage of their second or third spell rankups, giving them more damage to fight their lane opponent early on, but not their late games.

If the feeling was that they just weren't durable enough in the late game to make up for their lack of damage, we could buff base stats or defensive scaling.

Would you be adjusting their mana costs at all?  This probably isn't a big issue, but with the changes to {{item:1054}}, many tanks probably won't be going {{item:2033}} for a start and as such are having problem with mana sustain.

Is this a reasonable trade off though?  Cause I've heard people going triple dorans just to make up for the mana sustain that they lost.

You also need the mana for waveclearing now because sunfire is too shitty of an item to grab
 
its reduced radius originating from character model means very large champions have trouble dealing any damage at all , a multiple stacks cho gath can't even damage enemies with it for example though thats an extreme case

but still i cant hit the entire wave any more and it's not useful for fighting enemies either other items are more cost and slot efficient and so you grab 3 dorans ring  for mana regen and a bit of ap to sort of make up for it this way you can spam forever because you get 150% regen and 12 mana per minion

The reduced radius of {{item:3751}} was easily the biggest stealth nerf in the update. Before the update you could reasonably expect to clear waves without having to use abilities as a tank once you bought it, but now tanks just can not compete with other solo laners at pushing waves without using their abilities on the waves.
Tanks were never "high damage threats".  What are you even talking about?

I'm not sure where you've been, but there have been cases. Poppy for a while could kill you with a rotation (Especially if you had a build like Sunfire, CInderhulk, Titanic, Iceborn and/or Deadmans).
 
Maokai had enough damage and cooldown to kill you with 2-3 rotations while sticking to you, under the safety of his ult. 

Nautilus was practically a fighter with the damage from Q>E>AA>W>R>E. 

Zac could kill if he landed his E, a few W's and all the bounces on his ult.

They weren't high damage threats like say a Syndra, but compared to how hard they were to kill, they were a force in their own right if they got into the backline.
Compared to everyone else, they killed a lot slower.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-07T20:57:30.533+0000)
>
> If tanks are worse, it could definitely be because their core items are numerically weaker.

wait for it
> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-07T20:57:30.533+0000)
>
> It could also be because they crutch heavily on Sunfire's damage effect (especially in pvp combat), and that effect undeniably took some hits.


Bingo!
Tanks were nothing but glorified fighters, they were ALL without a single exception about dealing damage while being unkillable
Their tankiness fell off in late game due to penetration

i have to say thank you for making them unable to 1v1 anyone in midgame when strong (cough poppy) but you didn't fixe anything about their late game tankiness


they're still feast or famin, they're tanky if they snowballed and managed to get their items before enemy back line penetration
Black cleaver is still stupid despite being built in every situation

the only exception to this is {{champion:113}} because the rework gave her a reliable tank steroid that does not fall off in late game as it scales and surpasses penetration

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-07T20:57:30.533+0000)
>
> As we continue to get more information, if tanks are too weak, we're in a good position to just do follow up buffs to tanks specifically. 

that's a hell ton of work then good luck for it friendo!
> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-07T20:57:30.533+0000)
>
>If tank items have less Health on them, for example, we can buff up tank Health ratios to compensate, and because we're buffing the tanks and not the items

except that losing some hp on nautilus and shen shield is far from being the problem at least in my personal experience as i saw both of those champions in my games

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-07T20:57:30.533+0000)
>
> 
> Basically, it's very possible tanks are weaker than they should be at the moment, but I do think the ecosystem has been improved such that we can more reasonably adjust individual tanks.

or maybe finally dealing with {{item:3153}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3036}}  you know

but that's none of my business as a janna main
Something about tanks being feast or famine really sounds like it shouldn't be a thing considering how their late game works.

but they are, i'm sorry to say the truth

feast if they snowballed and got their tank items before anti tank items

famin if they didn't and they won't do anything and die like paper

Something is just seriously fucked when you have a whole (should be) necessary class that already ***KNOWS*** they will get absolutely fucked in a just a few seconds come late game, with no lategame itemization and nothing to do about it/no way to avoid it, while also having the lowest gold income of any class and one of the worst early games before they get health + resists. . . and then they are fucking feast or famine for the one part of the game they are actually supposed to be strong in, the mid game.
seriously though tanks lost about 70 absorption per item. that is about half an auto attacks worth of damage, per item. tanks weren't feelin so tanky before neither.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-07T20:57:30.533+0000)
>
> If tanks are worse, it could definitely be because their core items are numerically weaker. It could also be because they crutch heavily on Sunfire's damage effect (especially in pvp combat), and that effect undeniably took some hits.
> 
> As we continue to get more information, if tanks are too weak, we're in a good position to just do follow up buffs to tanks specifically. If tank items have less Health on them, for example, we can buff up tank Health ratios to compensate, and because we're buffing the tanks and not the items, we're at less risk of balance issues due to poaching.
> 
> Basically, it's very possible tanks are weaker than they should be at the moment, but I do think the ecosystem has been improved such that we can more reasonably adjust individual tanks.

Nerfing lee sin will fix 50% of your problems.

> core items are numerically weaker

http://i.imgur.com/yNlQWRM.jpg

Can we just see a stat update of all the tanks across the board? Higher base HP would go a long way. Especially for tanks like Shen, who have lower base stats than people who are supposed to be squishy like Zed.

Note that a lot of people are still building sunfire on maokai and nautilus so there is also an element of getting used to building new items first. It is likely better to rush gauntlet or another armor item since sunfire does not give much outside of waveclear now.
In which case I question what the point of changing it was when the changes have made it a noob trap.

It is good on champions that cannot waveclear but otherwise have decent dueling power. Shen is a good example of this, it just got changed to not be the item everyone gets because it does everything that anyone wants.

So now its an item no one wants. Bruisers don't want it because it doesn't deal good champion damage and tanks don't want it because by the time they finish it teamfights will start up and so wave clear has less value since the rest of their team will have better wave clear. So most will just switch to frozen fist which still has teamfight benefits while giving some wavelet while Sunfire is just built on Shen and Yorick.

>If tanks are worse, it could definitely be because their core items are numerically weaker. It could also be because they crutch heavily on Sunfire's damage effect (especially in pvp combat), and that effect undeniably took some hits.

The problem here is that Sunfire is pure garbage. It's just not a good enough item to ever justify building. There is never a reason to go Sunfire over Deadman's Plate. 

>As we continue to get more information, if tanks are too weak, we're in a good position to just do follow up buffs to tanks specifically. If tank items have less Health on them, for example, we can buff up tank Health ratios to compensate, and because we're buffing the tanks and not the items, we're at less risk of balance issues due to poaching.

Terrible idea, you're just going to end up with tanks building Titanic Hydra and Triforce. Why do you think tanks won't just poach other classes items when you over buff them and make their itemisation trash?

You're also looking at making all tanks supports as well. Why bother with expensive items when you can just go bot, get no gold and be a tank anyway.

I get the problem you have is things like Tank Fizz and Tank Ekko, but your "solution" just causes more problems. A better solution would be to take Fizz's AD/lv and cripple it, take it from 3 to 1 so he can't buy Triforce, add some bonus damage on hit to his passive if he needs it to farm and trade.

Well, the biggest thing riot nerfed way too much was Zac. His new ult specifically, it can yield bigger rewards, but now it makes his kit even clunkier and more predictible, you have to land his E, which basically flashed the opponent that it is coming. (still easily usable and great the E rocks.) Then his R used to work really well, because it gave multipl blobs on multi hit, then it disrupted from the middle pushing some back and some forward. The new way that he ult works makes his E jump into the enemy and if you miss it his ult is nearly useless unless you want it to have 1/100 th of its old effect and his q is great in theory, but you also made it clunkier, you wanted all his moves to have massive amounts of counter play, but you just added too much counter play, to where Zac is hit or miss, and using his moves is a huge gamble. Going in has to be guarinteed and someone else has to lock them down first, zac can't really engage and his ult can't disengage, just bring back his old ult for the love of jeez, because thats why his win-rate went down so much to 37 percent. I looked at the rework originally and I was like they ruined him, but if you wanna keep his new ult it needs like a 0 cast time to be close to as useful, because the old ult bounced multiple times and each was a knock-up if the enemy was not hit yet. This made it a powerful peeling tool and engaging tool. Now Zac can only engage and he cannot do that very well, because people are almost always out of the fight by that time unless he lands his e first in which case it is likely flashed which is good I guess, but makes you look silly. Overall his ult even with a 0 second time on it would be close to the same usefulness as his old ult. Personally, I think his ult needs reverting, and if you want you can keep his old q or revert it too, but his ult is a massive downgrade. I loved Zac for his old ult utility and play making his new ult just does one thing, and I feel like his old ult was what gave zac the feel he had and made him truly who he was his new ult feels like a knock-off of his fromer self. The bouncing multiple times sending blobs everywhere and his chaotic unstable nature. Flash push towards your team was awesome, but r disengage was also amazing especially with the speed boost you could engage or save, but now you can dive balls deep into the enemy team, with weaker stats, less damage and be almost guarenteed to fail what you are doing with giant windup times. Just please Fix his ult all I ask I really loved Zac as a champion

Health isn't the problem.. you add health back to items that will only make Bork even more of a must buy for every marksman than it already is. Hell, it's already the first item the top adcs are rushing in order to even survive to get their crit items..

Riot lied to all.

You are not tankier now that health has been nerfed across the board in exchange for 10 armor.

Knowing how people like vayne will still 3 shot a tank with 500 armor. Yes, happened to me yesterday.

Overall this patch should have been called the Tanks butchery. Since nothing gives you health anymore it takes so many items to become as tanky as before that is not worth it.

> 
> Overall this patch should have been called the Tanks butchery. Since nothing gives you health anymore it takes so many items to become as tanky as before that is not worth it.

Vayne is supposed to kill tanks, shes bad at everything else.

> [{quoted}](name=Rexxiee,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2017-05-07T16:39:14.329+0000)
>
> Vayne is supposed to kill tanks, shes bad at everything else.

You're right except she's not. She builds just like any other ADC does. She still kills squishies just as quickly

> [{quoted}](name=Jbels,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2017-05-07T17:04:33.441+0000)
>
> You're right except she's not. She builds just like any other ADC does. She still kills squishies just as quickly

But she dies before she gets into auto range.

For her to do damage she has to walk into harm.

> [{quoted}](name=Rexxiee,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-05-07T17:08:03.732+0000)
>
> But she dies before she gets into auto range.
> 
> For her to do damage she has to walk into harm.

So does every other ADC? You could Argue Cait doesn't, but I'm pretty sure every other ADC has to "walk up" to start autoing. That's the nature of the game

He's arguing that she has no way to hurt people outside of her auto range. 

She's still ranged though.

Her auto range is 550. This is the 3rd highest non-empowered ranges in the game. The only ranged auto champions that can outrange vayne is: Level 18 Tristana, Cait, Ashe, Anivia, Annie, Varus, and Zyra.

Everyone else is either at or below her Auto range.

Source: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Range

Vayne is  considered short-ranged because nothing in her kit allows her to affect a unit beyond her autoattack range.

Almost every other ADC has an ability which allows them to farm/poke/waveclear from beyond their autoattack range.

I believe the only other exception is Tristana (whose passive increases her autoattack range).

She is considered short range because of her skillset. But she has so many tools to get into range that I wouldn't consider her short ranged. She has her passive, her ultimate which increases her passive MS and her Q. That's more than enough for her to get into her "short" range to kill you in 3 shots.
Range is far more important considering how easily the enemy can Target you compared to how easily you can get in range.
But you can't be targeted when you're invisible with your ult and it's much harder to target a tumbling vayne. Her hitbox gets smaller during the tumble and she moves faster.
That doesn't mean anything. Her range is still the lowest
Her range isn't the lowest. What are you talking about?
True damg is Cancer to this game...

> [{quoted}](name=Awhegark,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vIFAEjk7,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-05-07T16:27:07.435+0000)

And people were whining about the possibility of a tank meta. HA! More like Third item GA Fiora / Pantheon / Camille meta
I'd really like to see the replay of a vayne THREE SHOTTING you as a tank with 500 armor.  I'll give you $100 if you can provide me with that replay.   I have a feeling my money is safe.

Moakai just a CC bot now.

Dude has a higher winrate as support than top lane LOL.
and that's just because his sapplings ward better than trinkets with 70 second duration, he's a stun bot as well as a ward bot.
More betting for warding than stuns imo.

#MAYBE BECAUSE THE GENIOUS BUFFED EVERY ADC ITEM AND REDUCED THE COST OF THEM, PLUS ADC ARE DEALING 5% MORE DAMAGE TO TANKS. IF YOU LOOK AT IT ALL TANKS ARE SINKING IN WINRATE AND PLAYRATE, WHILE ADC ARE INCREASING IN KILLS PER GAME AND DAMAGE DONE. BIAS MUCH RITO, THANK YOU!!
All caps + Bold really isn't doing you any favors.
What's sad though is he's not wrong, just presented it in an un-asthetically appealing way.
sejuani's not even a tank anymore, she's strongest using triforce and other fighter items
considering they nuked her base AD+ base attack speed i don't think so

Her base AD isn't even that bad. It's two bellow Fizz's AD at every level and he seems fine with it.

Tri is really fucking good on her and I was the biggest critic of this before her release. Tri's damage is only 20 lower on her than it is on Irelia at most anyway, she gets great use out of the Phage, she loves the CDR and her "nuked" base AS is completely standard at 0.625, she just had really high base AS before.

The phage and CDR work just as well with {{item:3025}} though, which also makes you tankier and gives you valuable team utility (helping your squishies kite, or helping you land followup attacks to stack your E).  In what kind of team comp do you expect the higher damage of triforce to be more valuable?
